Their understanding of these events was convoluted, blurring the distinctions between different prophetic occurrences. Jesus, in His response, chose his own unique approach to addressing their inquiries. Referred to as The Little Apocalypse, this segment in Mark is believed to take inspiration from Jewish apocalyptic literature adapted by Mark and attributed to Jesus. Additionally, Matthew and Luke's accounts align with the general theme found in Mark 13.
